entry.string: The Netquery module includes multidomain and IP/AS whois, DNS queries, email address validation, port services lookup, HTTP requests, ping, traceroute and looking glass router interrogation functions. Availability of each query type, local and remote execution, and all entries in the whois, port services and looking glass data tables are configurable.
From Netquery's main administration menu, you have six choices:
: From this menu option, you can select which Netquery functions will be available to users of your site, configure local and remote excution and set defaults.
: From this menu option, you can edit, add or delete whois "lookup links" between top level domain (TLD) entries and whois servers.
: From this menu option, you can edit, add or delete port services data entries, including keyword comments on vulnerabilities displayed to port lookup users.
: From this menu option, you can edit, add or delete the flagging data used for services and exploits, including keywords, font colors and search lookup URLs.
: From this menu option, you can edit, add or delete "looking glass" router entries overriding default settings and passwords for individual IPv4 and IPv6 daemons.
: From this menu option, you can examine or delete entries in the log that is maintained by Netquery's access monitor and spambot blocker.
There are no included hooks with this module.
Further information on the Netquery module can be found in the
